IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO MEET THE CURRENT AND FUTURE HEALTH NEEDS OF THE GREATER NORTHEAST LOS ANGELES BY PROVIDING ACCESS TO A RANGE OF HIGH QUALITY, AFFORDABLE HEALTH SERVICES IN A FINANCIALLY RESPONSIBLE MANNER.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO MEET THE CURRENT AND FUTURE HEALTH NEEDS OF THE GREATER NORTHEAST LOS ANGELES BY PROVIDING ACCESS TO A RANGE OF HIGH QUALITY, AFFORDABLE HEALTH SERVICES IN A FINANCIALLY RESPONSIBLE MANNER.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART II, LINE 10, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: 2013 OTHER INCOME 405646 2014 OTHER INCOME 348695 2015 OTHER INCOME 266772 2016 OTHER INCOME 259925 2017 OTHER INCOME 537358

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION ALSO APPLIES THE PROVISIONS OF FASB ASC TOPIC NO. 740, "ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES" ("ASC 740"). ASC 740 CLARIFIES THE UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES RECOGNIZED IN AN ENTERPRISE'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH FASB STATEMENT NO. 109, "ACCOUNTING FOR INCOME TAXES, AND PRESCRIBES A RECOGNITION AND MEASUREMENT OF A TAX POSITION TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN ON A TAX RETURN. ASC 740 ALSO PROVIDES GUIDANCE ON DERECOGNITION OF TAX BENEFITS, CLASSIFICATION ON THE BALANCE SHEET, INTEREST AND PENALTIES, ACCOUNTING IN INTERIM PERIODS, DISCLOSURE AND TRANSITION. THE FOUNDATION HAS DETERMINED THAT THE ADOPTION OF ASC 740 DID NOT RESULT IN THE RECOGNITION OF ANY LIABILITY FOR UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS AND THAT THERE ARE NO UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS THAT WOULD, IF RECOGNIZED, AFFECT THE EFFECTIVE TAX RATE. THE FOUNDATION'S INCOME TAX RETURNS REMAIN SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION FOR ALL TAX YEARS ENDED ON OR AFTER MARCH 31, 2015 FOR STATE INCOME TAX RETURNS AND MARCH 31, 2016 FOR FEDERAL INCOME TAX RETURNS WITH REGARDS TO ALL TAX POSITIONS AND THE RESULTS REPORTED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART III, LINE 4A, PROGRAM SERVICE ACCOMPLISHMENTS:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ESTABLISHED IN 1981, ARROYO VISTA PROVIDES A FULL COMPLEMENT OF PRIMARY AND PREVENTIVE HEALTHCARE SERVICES FOR THE ENTIRE FAMILY. ITS MEDICAL SERVICES ARE DIRECTED TO THE FIVE STAGES OF THE LIFE CYCLE: PRENATAL, PEDIATRICS, ADOLESCENTS, ADULT MEDICINE (INCLUDING WOMEN'S HEALTH), AND GERIATRIC MEDICINE. MEDICAL SPECIALTY, OTHER HEALTH AND ANCILLARY SERVICES PROVIDED INCLUDE PODIATRY, DENTAL, OPTOMETRY, LABORATORY, RADIOLOGY, ULTRASOUND, MAMMOGRAMS, PHARMACEUTICAL SERVICES AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICE. HEALTH PROMOTION AND DISEASE PREVENTION AND ENABLING SERVICES ARE ALSO PROVIDED. FREE ON-GOING HEALTH SCREENINGS, ANNUAL ADULT AND CHILDREN'S HEALTH FAIRS, AND REGULARLY SCHEDULED HEALTH EDUCATION CLASSES ARE PROVIDED TO PATIENTS AND THE COMMUNITY. ARROYO VISTA SERVICES ARE PROVIDED IN A CULTURALLY SENSITIVE, LINGUISTICALLY APPROPRIATE, AND COMPASSIONATE MANNER. ARROYO VISTA PROMOTES CONTINUITY OF CARE AND ENSURES THAT SERVICES ARE THE MOST COMPREHENSIVE POSSIBLE. SERVICES ARE PROVIDED TO PATIENTS REGARDLESS OF ABILITY TO PAY. PATIENTS WITH OR WITHOUT INSURANCE ARE WELCOME AT ARROYO VISTA. ARROYO VISTA IS ACCREDITED BY THE JOINT COMMISSION SINCE 1994 FOR ALL ITS WORK AND EFFORTS WITH MEETING NATIONAL STANDARDS OF HEALTH CARE AND FOR CONTINUOUSLY PROVIDING SAFE AND EFFECTIVE CARE OF THE HIGHEST QUALITY AND VALUE. IN 2013, ARROYO VISTA ACHIEVED PATIENT CARE MEDICAL HOME CERTIFICATION FROM THE JOINT COMMISSION FOR ITS CONTINUOUS WORK AND EFFORTS WITH MEETING NATIONAL STANDARDS OF HEALTH CARE AND FOR PROVIDING A MEDICAL HOME THAT ALL PATIENTS CAN CALL THEIR OWN. FROM ITS HUMBLE BEGINNING IN 1981 AS A SMALL STOREFRONT CLINIC, IT HAS GROWN TO A NETWORK OF FIVE HEALTH CENTERS AND A MOBILE CLINIC WITH OVER 93,000 PATIENT VISITS IN 2017 BECOMING THE MOST COMPREHENSIVE HEALTH CARE PROVIDER ACCESSIBLE TO THE RESIDENTS OF NORTHEAST LOS ANGELES. IN SEPTEMBER 2017, ARROYO VISTA RECEIVED FEDERAL FUNDING FOR MENTAL HEALTH AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE SERVICES TO EXPAND ACCESS TO MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES, AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE SERVICES FOCUSING ON THE TREATMENT, PREVENTION, AND AWARENESS OF OPIOID ABUSE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EXPLANATION: THE INFORMATIONAL RETURN IS PREPARED BY AN OUTSIDE ACCOUNTANT. IT IS THEN REVIEWED BY THE CFO. ONCE APPROVED, THE RETURN IS PROVIDED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS BEFORE IT IS E-FILED WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EXPLANATION: ARROYO VISTA BOARD MEMBERS SHALL COMPLETE A DIRECTOR QUESTIONNAIRE ANNUALLY CONFIRMING THEIR INDEPENDENT STATUS AND COMPLIANCE WITH THE AGENCY'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EXPLANATION: ARROYO VISTA'S PERSONNEL COMMITTEE HAS RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE REVIEW OF PERSONNEL POLICIES AND PROCEDURES INCLUDING COMPENSATION AND BENEFIT PROGRAMS. ARROYO VISTA EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE'S RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE YEARLY EVALUATION OF THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER'S PERFORMANCE AND COMPENSATION, WHICH IS THEN PRESENTED TO THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR FINAL REVIEW AND APPROVAL. OTHER OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES UNDERGO AN ANNUAL APPRAISAL REVIEW TO DETERMINE PROMOTION TO A HIGHER PAY LEVEL OR FOR MERIT INCREASES. THE CEO WILL MAKE THE DECISION ON MERIT INCREASES BASED ON THE SUPERVISOR'S AND/OR EXECUTIVE'S RECOMMENDATION AND EMPLOYEE PERFORMANCE AT THE TIME OF THE APPRAISAL REVIEW.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EXPLANATION: ARROYO VISTA MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST, AND TO INDEPENDENT AUDITORS DURING THEIR ANNUAL INDEPENDENT FINANCIAL AUDIT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART X, LINE 15, OTHER ASSETS
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AT MARCH 31, 2018, THE FOUNDATION HAD A RECEIVABLE THAT REPRESENTED UNCONDITIONAL PROMISES TO USE THE FACILITY LOCATED AT 6000 NORTH FIGUEROA STREET, LOS ANGELES, CA 90042, FROM THE CITY OF LOS ANGELES, DEPARTMENT OF GENERAL SERVICES (THE "CITY"). THE INITIAL TERM OF THE AGREEMENT WAS FOR THE RENT-FREE USE OF THE BUILDING FOR 20 YEARS STARTING IN JUNE 1987. THE AGREEMENT WAS AMENDED IN OCTOBER 2014, AND THE LEASE WAS RENEWED FOR ANOTHER 15 YEARS AT A NOMINAL RENT OF $1 PER YEAR. THE FOUNDATION USES THE PREMISES FOR THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF PROVIDING HEALTH CARE SERVICES TO THE COMMUNITY.
